Reviews.Title: “Does it really need another 5***** review?”
Reviews.Author: raf1860
Reviews.Content: This hotel ranks in the top 5 I have stayed in. When I visited last February - the week before the Academy Awards - the hotel was fully booked. You would not have known it...It's discreet elegance, the personal service, and the way management operates behind the scenes - it is truly impressive. (But the Four Seasons group is known for their attention to detail...) The location is perfect; you almost miss it because it blends in so well with the neighborhood. Despite it's size, it feels like a small, high-quality hotel. I would highly highly recommend it for a stay in LA - it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysplanning1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a few weeks ago for a wedding. The attention to detail and the service were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, amazing flawless service, loved it”
Reviews.Author: IbizaPolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days on our honeymoon and I absolutely loved this hotel, the staff were great right across the board, the perfect balance of professionalism and friendliness/warmth. The hotel is immaculate with great facilities. Lovely pool area, great room (we stayed in a suite) Food is great too....fantastic room service menu & lovely restaurant garden setting. I even loved and made lots of use of the in-house alterations service. Worth every penny and actually good value for the quality and experience. Really amazing, we will be back....I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel. not too big but very warm.”
Reviews.Author: tomatojar
Reviews.Content: located in the heart of Beverly hills. close to The Grove Mall. plenty of tropical flowers around the whole hotel. beatiful garden area. standard Four Seasons room setting. Very good experience in LA this time!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Excellence”
Reviews.Author: NickBB
Reviews.Content: i always stay at the hotel for business but this time took my family along for the ride. the adjoining room made life easy and the hotel management were their usual classy selves.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: VR_Bianchi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, suites, location, decor, etc! Excellent hotel, I will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: feferman
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for over 20 years and it has consistently one of the best hotels in the world for comfort, service, and security. The hotel is well maintained, clean, and comfortable. Great pool, bar, and other public areas. In fact the bar off the lobby is one of the coolest places to hang out in BH. Room service is great and available 24 hours a day. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street in Beverly Hills and is actually a comfortable walking distance from neighborhood restaurants, cafes, and shops. Overall this hotel has a nice residential feel (as if you are part of the neighborhood). This property is everything you would expect from a Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “A truly special place for anyone”
Reviews.Author: lilgil
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this particular Four Seasons is one that made us total devotees to this company. In May of 2008 my father had a heart transplant at Ceders Sinai. The hotel had a special rate for people with family in the hospital. But that's only part of how well we were treated during that time. We returned throughout his recovery staying there each time, and after. After so many glorious visits I wrote to the general comments page on their website and thanked them for all the care and detail they put into making guests feel truly special. I received an exquisite letter back from one of the executives and from then I was hooked. Seattle, New York, Carlsbad, and then Lisbon. The ways in which this hotel has made me feel like their most valued guest. Every time.

Reviews.Title: “luxury personified”
Reviews.Author: sawlanimd
Reviews.Content: lives up to the expectations. as soon as you check in, you are welcomed by the staff.special thanks to Ms Keisha who remembered it was my daughter's birthday and had a cake and surprise complimentary spa voucher ready for her. Rooms; spacious, clean & updated, each room has a iPad and for once a decent basic wireless connection which is complimentary, one can upgrade for a fee for a faster speed connection. room service is standard and quick. bathroom are clean and spacious. Location; excellent, located in a quiet residential area, 5 minutes by car to rodeo drive and 30 min to universal studio, kodak theater and 45 min to disneyland. Amenities; decent gym and pool, spa is undergoing renovation. Food; good, pricey which is expected. One has multiple choice in selecting a hotel in beverly hills, but what makes four season stand out is the service, right from the valet attendant to room cleaning personnel and attention to detail, plus where else would you get a complimentary Rolls Royce / Mercedes S550 ride to nearby shops. Like my daughter said," four seasons forever".

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ojal D
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel.. wanted to stay here many times and finally got the chance.. it was great and will def return!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: PhilHuang
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on my other colleagues on trip advisor. Got a king suite and arrived at 12pm and wasn't checked in unil 2pm. To be expected but a little disappointing. Their cafe (which we sat in whilst waiting) had great food fish tacos and sashimi platter were exceptional. The rooms had 1 bedroom, 2 bathrooms and all the amenities you'd expect. Service was great. It was refreshing to see people doing good things without wanting a tip. Great Bed and good sleep. They also organised a itinerary for us to go on tours. Very special. Rooms were beautifuk. Had a IPAD control panel where meals, taxis, checking out can all be done. Definitely in a great area with great service, No complaints whatsoever and will return if I come through LA again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: oneolivepls
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location as I enjoy staying on the West side. Hotel room was lovely with a garden view. Bathroom had great light for getting dressed and putting on makeup. Would for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous spot for business and Easter holiday!”
Reviews.Author: FreeBird68
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of visiting the property twice in 2011 staying in an Executive Suite with a balcony. The first was a family trip for Easter break with our 7 year old daughter and second was for a business trip. We enjoyed the glamorous pool and loved the access to the luxury house cars! The restaurants, service and atmosphere far exceeded our expectations! We even had the opportunity to share our great experiences with the owners while dining at Culina. Easter brunch complete with the Easter bunny and egg hunt is over the top! The hotel now ranks as one of our favorites! We have made Easter at the Four Seasons a tradition for our family and look forward to returning next month!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, True Four Seasons Experience”
Reviews.Author: oceanman18
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with excellent service from Concierge Desk to Housekeeping. It was my first stay at this hotel, previously stayed at the Four Seasons Wilshire which is also great, but this is my new spot for sure. We had lunch and dinner at Culina, both were spectacular. I had the halibut for lunch, my colleague had a burger, both are highly recommended. The service was very quick and both of our servers treated us like we are celebrities as they deal with them on a regular basis. I had a dinner by myself the next day and had the Veal Chop, it was seriously to die for. I had a chance to chat with one of the managers, Italian gentleman, light brown haired and told him how good everything was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in 5 stars all over the world, I would have to say this is one of the best. Great staff. Great service. Great facility. Running into Carlos Santana and a host of other celebs was also pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: amicorum
Reviews.Content: Look forward to go back! Devoted service, excellent food, concierge really nice and who is providing excellent advices (reservations, places to go to...).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Gai_12
Reviews.Content: My family & I just stayed at the Four Seasons Beverly Hills in adjoining rooms. From the moment we drove up in our hire car to the time we left , the staff could not do enough for us. We never had to ask 'twice' for anything! This is a true 5 star property in a lovely location in LA. (just off Wilshire Blvd, quiet neighbourhood area) It is walking distance to the Beverly Centre (there is also a complimentary car service) for shopping and there are numerous restaurants within walking distance. You are 20 minutes from Universal by car (an easy drive), 5 minutes to Rodeo drive and 30 minutes to the Santa Monica & Venice Beach and 30-45 minutes to LA Airport. I would not hesitate to recommend this fabulous hotel & you never know who might be staying there is are a star watcher!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a Great place! We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Sockie26
Reviews.Content: We moved over to the Four Seasons after a few nights at The Sofiel and were very satisfied with the up-grade. The staff was fantastic, from the valet, bellmen, concierge to the restaurant servers. We utilized the Hotel "house car" with a great experience, as Nelson was very professional and helpful. The Hotel itself was awesome with many amenities that are top notch. We actually watched the Super Bowl there in the lounge that they had setup for quite a nice crowd while catering each Teams specialty stadium foods, which was a nice touch. We will be back here for sure as they treated us very good and made you feel very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be the best hotel in Los Angeles. A luxurious, secluded atmosphere, yet near everything.”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: There are newer, more fancy and more interesting hotels in LA. However, this hotel is still the best. It has an elegant, quiet and relaxed atmosphere with all of the best Four Seasons amenities. The hotel gets it all right for the luxury traveler. Everything, from the staff to the facilities to the experience is first rate without being overstated or looking like they try too hard. Particularly excellent extra touches are the incredibly friendly, professional and attentive staff, the peaceful and remote pool area and the knowledgeable and eager concierge desk. This hotel successfully offers all of the usual Four Seasons luxurious qualities near the attractions of Beverly Hills and West L.A., while preserving a feeling of seclusion and quiet. It does not get any better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Love love Cali”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I sincerely enjoyed my stay the location was great the service was outstanding. I really felt comfortable here because the staff made me feel welcomed and I loved that I could walk every where.

Reviews.Title: “When all you want to do is stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlyonelife99
Reviews.Content: How great is a hotel experience when all you want to do is stay on property? That's pretty much what we did this past January weekend when we were guests at this hotel. The complementary car service is a great value-add (perhaps it's strange to write about value when you are paying luxury rates). The hotel bar scene is clubby, pleasant and we spied several many celebs. The Sunday brunch was fabulous. The rooms stylishly comfortable, and even on a sold-out weekend, the rooms and common areas were quiet. For those who want that Beverly Hills vibe of being in-the-know with all of the elgance without all the flash, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Denise T
Reviews.Content: Since we live in Los Angeles we don't have the opportunity to stay in Beverly Hills very often. A Saturday night dinner dance gave us the opportunity. This is a fabulous hotel that has excellent service. Champagne bucket with ice and glasses arrived in less than 5 minutes. My dress needed steamed, and it was beautifully done in 30 minutes or less. Using the hotel's Rolls to go into town for dinner or shopping is fun. This is a gracious, understated hotel. Even though we live 5 miles away we will look for an excuse to return for a visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Stokedn1angel
Reviews.Content: My grandmother said that if you cannot say anything nice do not say anything at all. However that would not allow others to understand why in our opinion we regret staying at this hotel. So just one word of advice. If you book the car service from the airport check with them before you arrive so they remember to send a car. The car we booked for a late night arrival never turned up. Now I am sure the management will respond to this review by setting out eveything they did to try to make up for their failure (but which did not include an apology when we finally arrived at the hotel). But it was insufficient. They ruined our night's stay and when I suggested they might wish to offer a discount on the hundreds of pounds we paid for the room they declined. Most guests clearly love this hotel but from our perspective it failed to live up to the promises made by Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “One nights stay after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: visitor2009London
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel with excellent and friendly staff, onlet down by the waiting staff in the restaurant who seemed to have an "attitude" problem. Would stay here again. Excellent facilities including the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business travels.”
Reviews.Author: JesusArturoRomero
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a business trip, so it was very good and I had no need to pay anything, otherwise I would have taken another option. You have to try the Eggs Benedict and the Chips from the room service. Though everything is far from each other in L.A. You can stay here if you have a car and move round Beverly Hills. It's Walking Distance (if you DO like walking) from Rodeo Drive (30min) and Beverly Center (20min). Mi room was in 6th Floor and I could see beautiful sunshines from my balcony (yes! It has a beautiful balcony) and also I could see the Hollywood Sign in the distance. The TV is big, the bed comfortable and the bathroom has like 3 rooms inside! 1 for the shower, wc and tina and another for mirror, pile and make up (if you're a fancy lady). If you can afford this hotel, it's totally recommendable and also maybe you can see one or another movie star in the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAMGLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here with our 2 year old, the hotel were great - looked after all our needs, at dinner they gave our son some fruit snacks to keep him occupied until dinner arrived. Note this hotel does not have children's activities etc, but were very accommodating to our requests. Will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part of My Job Is Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: JMO73
Reviews.Content: I get to stay here a lot through work - and it is definitely a big perk. Whether I'm there for a day or a month I always experience the same high standards from the staff. Nothing is ever too much trouble and they take great time in getting to know you and your preferences, making you feel at home. The rooms are spacious and well equipped with Bose Sound Systems, DVD players and iPads in each room as standard. Amenities in the bathroom are luxurious (Bulgari products) and house keeping is able to provide any of the items that you may have left at home. However, this hotel is not just about the room. It's about the whole experience of being there. The spa is great, with one of the best kept and well equipped changing rooms that I've ever seen (it's so spacious you can literally lose hours in there between the sauna, steam room, power showers, refreshing cucumber water and myriad of vanity products. The gym is small but perfectly formed - with complementary isotonic drinks and fruit to help you through your work out, and every piece of equipment that you may need (free weights, cardio machines, resistance machines, power plates, kettle balls, resistance bands, yoga mats). There's always plenty of room around the pool to secure a lounger and to be waited on all day long (sadly, my work schedule rarely allows that luxury), and the hot tub is just heavenly. The hotel is in a great location with greats bars, restaurants and shops being within walking distance (yes, I did say walking)! It's also seems to be a 20 - 25 minute drive away from everywhere that I need to go. There is one BIG drawback from staying at this hotel. Once you've stayed here you'll find every other hotel a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “The Crown Jewel of the Four Seasons Empire”
Reviews.Author: MadameO
Reviews.Content: Well, you can't escape the holidays, you just can not. Nor can you run from your problems. But I did needed to try to do both this past Christmas and the Four Seasons at Beverly Hills was probably the only good idea I have come up with in the past two turbulent months! This Four Seasons is truly a welcoming, coddling cocoon. By the time I landed, got the car, and stopped at the CVS for Robitussin, Coldeez and potato chips (oh, yeah, of course I had a cold on top of all the other good stuff I had going on), it was on the late side, but the welcome at the front door, by name, of course, almost moved me to tears. Yeah, yeah, I know the passport photo trick hotels like the 4S use to identify their guests, but it felt warm and genuine and I went for it- hook, line and sinker. I had a suite (God bless Amex Platinum) big enough for one of my BFF's to stay one night, and a a balcony that looked over the mountains. Breakfast was amazing- there's a mixed juice drink called the Italian Mob you must get. The spa was great- had a massage with a wonderfully attentive massuese. The gym has been recently renovated, and there is n o lack of amentites there, either- coffee, waters, headphones- you name it, they either have it or they will get it. The staff was stellar all through out the hotel. When megamillions went up to some astronomical sum, I had a melt down- I needed to get a ticket right away- if ever my chances would be in favor of me winning, it would be before my divorce goes through and I would have to split it with the creep. The concierge went crazy trying to find a place to get tix- lotto's not allowed in Bev Hills! Anyhow, what a place. I had to be dragged from there, tantrumming all the way to the airport and back to NY. Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wim H
Reviews.Content: Exteremly Excellent location. The reception staff were so kind and helpful. It was a wonderful stay and I really enjoyed my time. The hotel deserves more than 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: SusanT29
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best service I've ever received at a hotel! The staff were so attentive and helpful which was surprising given its in the middle of Beverly Hills. The doormen and valet went above and beyond. Our car was always ready with just minutes notice with 2 cold waters waiting for us! My husband and I both had spa treatments that were outstanding. One of the best massages I have received. I also had a pedicure which was good, but they really didn't have great facilities for pedicures. The lounge was cozy with adequate service. The rooms were nicely appointed, but not over the top. All-in-all, a really nice hotel, staff and stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 1huskergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights here for business, the staff was outstanding, from the valet when I arrived to the room service staff. My only complaint would be not having free wi-fi. I would stay again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every respect”
Reviews.Author: robotmuppet
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The service is impeccable. Our only advice is to stay away from Culina, a restaurant not worthy of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's so great I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: Valet - super nice and welcoming. Staff - oh so nice and understanding of how exhausted I was when I arrived. Room - perfect! I loved the Bulgari products, they smell so good. Concierge - huge help with directions, maps and tickets to events. Pool - i had a great lunch at the pool and the staff was very accommodating. They have books and mags to read and sunscreen on the house. The whirlpool was so perfect with a great view and worth every minute. Spa locker room - nice steam room and sauna. Gym - perfect size, great work out options and a cool view of the herb garden. Bar - a great place to meet cool people. They had a good live band and an outdoor terrace. Restaurant - I didn't get to try it, but it looked beautiful. Car service - I didn't get to take advantage of it, but they will drop you off and pick you up anywhere within two miles. The hotel was so fantastic that I didn't want to leave to go explore LA!

Reviews.Title: “Small stay, but very good”
Reviews.Author: The_road_house
Reviews.Content: I was there for just one day, but had a great experience nonetheless. The check-in was very quick, and the front desk lady gave me a corner room, which offered great views of the Beverly hills, and I could see the "hollywood"sign from my room. The room service and house keeping was great, and the food in Culina excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Two Seasons Only”
Reviews.Author: melbwaikikilover
Reviews.Content: After reading such glowing reviews of the Four Seasons on Doheny, I was very dissapointed in our visit from Nov 6-11th. The hotel itself is quite lovely, although starting to get tired around the edges especially in the bathrooms- grouting and a single sink etc. The grounds are lovely as expected in a Four Seasons property and while the foyer all very early 90's in decor it was first class in appearance. What made the Four Season only Two Seasons for us, was the lack of any real connection with the guests and the staff, especially the front desk, all smiles, but no debth and no real interest in you as genuine guest in a top rate hotel. The valet parking is the worst in Beverly Hills with the parking staff having no idea if you are arriving or leaving the hotel to the point of frustration and even after I repeatedly told the front desk and manager about the problem, there was no acknowlegment of how bad it really was. On two occassions as we went to drive out, we were stopped by the parking staff welcoming us to the hotel!! Every day we had to ask for chilled water to replaced in the car, as the valet left the empty bottles in their holders when he brought the car up. The Four Seasons to us was only offered us Two Seasons of value and hospitality, so it's back to the Beverly Hills Hotel for our next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best...”
Reviews.Author: chas47a
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at the Four Seasons LA in April, June and December this year. All three visits were perfect. The staff members are friendly and provide an incomparable level of customer service. The pool, fitness facility and spa are excellent. I've never felt more comfortable at any other hotel in the world. We will definitely return to this world-class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “worst 5 star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: digitaldivaLV
Reviews.Content: At check in my debit card was charged $1367 for no particular reason since my hotel was already paid for. I was told after the fact that it is a hotel policy to have a $300 safety deposit for the room. This still doesn't explain the $1367 charge. It will take up to 10 business days for a refund. The room was small and very unimpressive. The beds were small and uncomfortable. The headboard design was like in a dorm. When I spoke to the assistant hotel manager about all the issues, she was very patronizing and gave me a one night valet refund ...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, what you should expect from a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FHANDS
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hotel by 6 pm, had to be out for an event by 7:30. I was promptly given my room, and was upgraded to a suite, in spite of me telling them not to bother, as I was in for just 1 night. Had my shoes cleaned and suit pressed, had a quick room service. Everything came just in time. Everyone, top to bottom, could not have been nicer, and more competent. On check out, delicious coffee and bakery items, and back home. Great team work, wonderful hotel, great people.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY ANYWHERE ELSE”
Reviews.Author: JESSEHAWAII
Reviews.Content: Nothing is better than this hotel.I have been to most that's why its number one.fitness room great to stay in shape while working.Lo.cation makes it to want to impress pull up here.Worth every penny when the boss is paying to ha ha

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: It goes without saying that a Four Seasons should be an excellent place to stay and this hotel does not disappoint. It's a beautiful hotel, filled with a constantly changing array of floral arrangements, a lovely pool, a top of the line gym and one of the most fascinating and ever changing bar scenes in LA. But so much of what makes this hotel four stars is it's staff. From the front desk staff who know your likes and dislikes, who remember what room style you prefer and on what floor, from the valets who seem to remember you know matter how long it's been since your last stay, to the room service employees who are genuinely friendly and happy to help you out. I prefer staying in Santa Monica if I can, there's just more to do and everything's closer, but it's so hard to choose something else over the Four Seasons. It's one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: orly k
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous time at the hotel. The fitness club is fantastic. I loved the cucumber water they provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very LA Very FS”
Reviews.Author: Vikram_A_Singh
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel....! everything was outstanding as usual, highly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to enjoy Beverly Hills in fully glory and glamour. Culina is superb

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: waves92
Reviews.Content: I've never seen a hotel this amazing! The staff are very friendly! The rooms are outstanding The pool is very clean The hotel is spotless No bad comments about this hotel Just Amazing I'm Coming Back!

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: Cglasb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons for one night for a business trip. First, I would like to say how pleasant everyone is from the parking people to the front desk - but they are not smothery and annoying - friendly and efficient? - check!. My room was spectacular (they upgraded me - I have no idea why, but it was amazing). Everything was spotless. The room faced the street, but I did not hear a thing and slept like a baby. Next day, got my car in two minutes from valet (who gave me complimentary water- nice!). Great location to everything. HIghly recommmend.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: lagent007
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Four Seasons Beverly Hills. Of course the amenities were top notch but what we appreciated the most was the service. Every staff member, from concierge to pool attendant to housekeeping greeted us with a smile even when we passed them in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: kate3111
Reviews.Content: just returned from a lovely stay in the 4 seasons ,beautiful hotel and the rooms are fabulous. their beds are the most comfortable ever, the only negative i have is the $35 charge for the parking for this hotel we werent told about this i presumed it would be $18,The other negative i have is the heaters on in the gym this would put you off but overall i would really recommend it and the staff there are so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect would be an understatement”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: If you want to be treated like royalty 24 x 7 then stay at this hotel. It is fantastic. Extremely attentive personnel wait on you better that you could possibly imagine. The rooms were immaculate. The gym is spectacular. If you want to have a truly enjoyable work-out experience then wait until you go there. It is covered but outdoors with beautiful plants all over the place so you feel like you are in a tropical garden while you are working out. This hotel is worth every penny spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: APremyanova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for couple of nights with my husband and it was fabulous. We remained very happy with the service, food and the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “You'll really feel spoiled staying at the first-class Four Seasons Hotel. Incredible staff, great room...A”
Reviews.Author: Derek C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I also stayed at the Four Seasons 3 nights in early October. The staff, from the parking valet to the reception desk to the person who delivers room service, provided exemplary service. We rank this hotel with the best of anywhere we've stayed around the world. The day we left, on a Sunday, the City was paving the road just outside, and it must have been a nightmare for the parking staff; you'd never know it - they were calm, organized, and polite as can be getting our car and helping us navigate around all the commotion. This is just one example of how much they impressed us.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could give this hotel more than 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Phylgary_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons 3 nights in early October. We have had the good fortune to travel extensively and have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world. This hotel has outdone them all. At check-in the reservationist came out from behind the counter to give us our keys and take us to the elevator. The bellman was already ahead of us with our luggage. The service here sets the standard for all hospitality businesses. The staff, food, and ambiance at Culina are first rate. The spa is fantastic -- quiet, elegant and staffed by people who make you feel so comfortable. I highly recommend a lady named Dallas for a facial. Off-site we had lunch at the Ivy and also dinner at Villa Blanca. It's not unusual to spot celebrities at these restaurants. When we were leaving the hotel, the valet attendant noticed we had a low tire and took our car and added air to the tire before we drove off. I would live here if I could.

Reviews.Title: “World Class!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dukes24-7
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. We stayed here for 1 week and also had our wedding here. The staff at the hotel are all amazing, we didn't lift a finger the whole time we were there! Concierge/pool staff and restaurant/bar staff made us feel special. Valet and doormen ensured you do not open a door during your whole stay, This hotel is perfect!! The hotel has a Rolls Royce as their house car which will take you out locally & also pick you up. Culina restaurant and the lounge bar are great, look out for celebrities, we were luckily enough to meet Matt Damon and Suge Knight. Location is great, only 5-10mins walk from Robertson and the Beverly Centre, and only 15mins from Rodeo Drive. We stayed in a one bed suite which was great, housekeeping did a good job. Special Thanks to Wina who helped us with our wedding and her service was the best I have ever experienced, she made our day unbelievably perfect. Thank you to the Four Seasons staff we will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: missyrsvp
Reviews.Content: This truly is one of my favorite hotels in the world. The service is top notch, the renovated pool is a fabulous place to bask in the sun, and the house car (a rolls royce) will take you anywhere you please. The walk-in closets are huge and unpacking service is the icing on the cake! Mini cupcakes were waiting for us one day when we returned from shopping, just because! Everywhere we went in the hotel the staff remembered our names. The spa is fantastic. If you have a chance to stay here, do not hesitate! book it now, you will be so happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “Service second to none!”
Reviews.Author: ausmike_1968
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the hotel, I felt very special. As others have pointed out, the service is exceptional but also very friendly. At the end of the day I looked forward to returning and being welcomed back. Nothing was too much trouble for staff, and the house car was particularly valuable for getting around. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location + Great service + Good rooms + outrageous extra charges”
Reviews.Author: ManhattanTripper
Reviews.Content: Lovely service, very nice rooms (if a bit small, but that goes with the age of the building.) The rooms were well equipped and tastefully furnished. The public rooms are a bit over the top in a slightly dated and stuffy style. Culina, the lobby level restaurant in the hotel, has lovely décor and breakfast was perfect on the outdoor terrace. Others in our party enjoyed dinner there very much. The food at the restaurant at the pool level was not good, however. Completely different experience from Culina. If we hadn't been entertaining business associates, we would have made a change. The gym is good, and the locker rooms beautiful and spotless. Room service was perfect, but as others on TripAdvisor have noted, unbelievably expensive. A breakfast of one fruit plate, one bagel w/ cream cheese & salmon, coffee, two juices, with 20% included tip and $4 service charge added, was $96. A lg. pot of coffee is $16. Go downstairs or eat everything in the minibar; it's going to be less painful. Here's another stab at a perennial complaint with almost every hotel in this level: WiFi was $15/24 hours. Note that it's 24 hours, not for a "day." if you check in at 10 and out at 12 the next day, that's TWO 24hr charges. When will these hotels realize that this makes everyone's blood boil? My colleague now has a Verizon MiFi, which provides him with a 4G connection everywhere for about $50/month. Just pointing out to management that these charges won't last forever. All said, this is a great place to stay, just beware that the room rate isn't the only thing to check.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: Lynnpatricia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights in September and were really impressed with this luxurious hotel. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The Pool area is lovely with friendly and attentive staff. The concierge service is second to none - follow their recommendations and you really cannot go wrong. A great bonus is the house car (a merc or a Rolls) which will take you anywhere within 2 miles and all complimentary! The 2 mile radius covers many of the local high spots such as The Farmers Market, The Grove and the many good restaurants nearby. We especially liked Mastros (try the lobster mash) and Katana, pricey but first class. Considering the traffic and the awful local taxis the house car is a real plus (it is on first come first serve basis and not bookable). Consider if you really need your own hire car here as the overnight parking cost is $35. The staff here are charming, friendly and very helpful and we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base to see LA from - fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Anajon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the four seasons for 3 nights bases in Trip Advisor reviews - we were not disappointed. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable, with great views of LA and the best beds of our whole holiday. The hotel was older, but had everything you needed for the stay. The pool area was fantastic and town car a great addition. The stand out however was the service, the staff printed maps, gave recommendations and advice and were overall brilliant. Top tips are to book the town car n hour in advance around dinner and you can self park for free if you don't want to pay valet parking (access is from rear of the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Layonacouche
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned home from a week in your hotel. It was a wonderful experience from the start until we left. Our trips in the Rolls Royce to Rodeo Drive & The Polo Lounge made it magical. We will be back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly run elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: iphonenyc
Reviews.Content: Being in Beverly Hills, this Four Seasons sees much action: from weddings, to award shows, celebrities, etc. I've stayed here a number of times and it is always excellent across the board. The rooms are great, pool area/gym fantastic, gardens lovely, food excellent. Can you tell this is a good review? If you do encounter a problem, just go to the concierge desk and it will be worked out. Have breakfast in the garden area of the restaurant. Simply enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we choose Four Seasons for our first LA experience!”
Reviews.Author: jillybean_1171
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Four Seasons LA at Beverly Hills and while it was pricey, we had the budget for it and wanted to splurge and the splurge was definately worth it. The hotel is amazing, the staff was terrific and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. We ended up with a 1 bedroom suite - which meant that my husband could be his typical early riser and I could sleep in! They tried to get us to upgrade when we first checked in - but at $100 per night - I doubt it would have been worth the extra expense. The concierge desk was a great help during our stay there and managed to help us get where we wanted to go. They have a terrific car service that will take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius - and that got us a lot of places that we would have otherwise had to pay a cab for. They also arranged for our car rental on a day that we wanted to drive the PCH. A great help which help make our experience a positive one. We had dinner in the restaurant there one night -La Culina. By far our most enjoyed dining experience while in Los Angeles! The food was amazing and the service even better! Could not have asked for anything better. Our only "sour spot" during the trip was the other guests at the hotel. I guess it is "typical LA" - but my husband and I were shocked at just how rude and snobby people could be to the service staff at the hotel. Just because you have lots of $$$ doesn't mean you can disrespect people so my husband and I would go above and beyond to be nice to them - to make up for those that weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: sbb16
Reviews.Content: Fabulous restaurant - really great tasting food! Very nice rooms Wonderful service

Reviews.Title: “A warmly stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomas1107
Reviews.Content: We were hosted warmly as a first time visitors of LA. Reception explained very detailed information about our stay. The house car was very helpful to us to go shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: JonCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the wedding of my cousin in August 11. The rooms very incredible and certainly on par with some of the best hotels in the world. What set this hotel apart was the customer service. No request was too much and I always felt totally looked after. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody thinking of stay in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark787
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Beverly Hills is a great place to stay in L.A. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous, getting us tickets to the Getty Villa with absolutely no advance notice and also customizing our brunch at the poolside restaurant. The car service is amazing -- we were driven around in a Rolls Royce twice and an S-class once, with the driver even picking us up after the service was technically done for the night. Can't recommend this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury defined”
Reviews.Author: Cmolvheartnnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with a friend who was there for nearly a month. The suite was beautiful, breakfast daily was delivered promptly. The staff was outstanding and we particularly enjoyed the complimentary Rolls taking us to & from shopping etc. The cabana/pool area & gym were tranquil and massages heavenly. Even the toiletries were divine. Dinner at Culina was outstanding and our server was fabulous and vert patient with our large and raucous party. He even went out of the way to have a fabulous salted caramel gelato dessert prepared for me when nothing else appealed. The bar scene was lively with music nightly & a see & be seen crowd, especially later in the evening. They were doing some prep work as I left for an awards reception and the noise in our suite overlooking pool/hills was troubling and they quickly moved my friend to a larger more fabulous suite. There is nothing like a Four Seasons bed and the service here was on par with what I have come to expect from this creme de la creme in other cities worldwide. Definitely the right choice in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - one of the best”
Reviews.Author: stella303
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived until the minute we left the service at the Four Seasons was absolutely top notch. The reception staff were so friendly and made a real effort with our children (Kisha is great!). The one bedroom suite was very comfortable. The pool was pretty good - but again the pool staff were superb in providing service. We could not fault this hotel in any way. Brilliant - would love to come back anytime

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: RDECT
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the hotel while on vacation. Service - excellent, as expected, particularly at the concierge desk (friendly and knowledgeable) and at the valet parking station. Suite - spacious and clean. Pool - the pool is small but was not overly crowded during our stay (even though the hotel was busy). There are lots of places to sit around the pool and nearby. My kids loved the poolside food.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and well located but nickel and dimed”
Reviews.Author: winchpete
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of Four Seasons reputation and the convenient location for Beverley Hills and Hollywood. Took the offer of a discounted upgrade to a deluxe suite on a high floor with views of downtown LA and the Hollywood Hills. This wasn't worth it as the view was obscured by mist after dark and until mid-morning. The whole hotel has a feel of 1930s luxury but with modern facilities that are well maintained. The bed was very comfortable. Bathroom facilties were excellent. Unfortunately some of the staff seemed to be after tips all the time. If a tip was not offered after help with luggage or valet parking, the person simply stood next to you in silence. Nobody ever asked for a tip but you quickly got the message. Despite the five star hotel room rates, there was still a charge of $10 a day for wi-fi. There was also a charge of $6 for toast with breakfast. I have never been charged for toast before. Overall I was pleased I stayed at this hotel but it is a shame that it was spoilt by some small and avoidable points.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloMD
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teenage sons stayed for three nights. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Conveniently located for Beverly Hills and Hollywood. Throughly enjoyed the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Always Superb”
Reviews.Author: jm514
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the FS Los Angeles a number of times and it is always a treat. Since the renovation all areas of the hotel are in great condition and stylishly updated. Most of the standard rooms are comparable to one another with differences in view. I am not sure there is a truly bad view to be had. We prefer the garden side of the hotel, but know others who prefer looking the other way toward BH and the ocean. The beds are typical FS beds, which means very comfortable. The one down side to the regular rooms and studio suites is the old fashioned tub/shower combo. It's not a deal breaker, but an unfortunate remnant of an older building. Our Executive Suite this last time had much nicer bathroom with a huge walk-in shower in addition to the tub. The things that really set this hotel apart are the attention to detail and service. There are few hotels we have stayed at, including some much more expensive than this one, where the service is so seamless. It reminds me of the FS in Hong Kong, which really is the epitome of stellar service. It is a perfect balance of friendliness and professionalism combined with an impeccable ability to anticipate your needs. There is no attitude at all, but they also deftly avoid being too folksy or familiar. The pool area is still one of our favorites. While it may not have the drama and grandeur of pools like the Hualalai FS and the Amangiri, it is peaceful, beautiful and impeccably attended by the staff. The food throughout the hotel, including poolside, is excellent. Culina is beautiful and food is very good. Their wine selection is broad and fair in pricing. They also often have good deals on hard to find wines and will pour almost all of their bottles as half bottles, which is rare. Finally, if you have the occasion to be here at Christmas they do a pretty incredible job of decorating the place to the hilt so it feels festive despite the lack of snow outside. We are looking forward to our next stay in a month and will continue to make the FS Los Angeles our home away from home when we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Super duper!”
Reviews.Author: havanagirlGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff whose exemplary service was such a welcome after a long journey. Toys and cookies for the kids, terrific breakfast at the hotel, and again by the pool. Sorry it was too short a stay. This hotel makes families feel very welcome and other hotels should follow their lead on how to run a top quality operation The manager is running a very special show there.

Reviews.Title: “I wish it was a longer stay”
Reviews.Author: JuanCarlos_11
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. Spa is extremely good. I suggest to have the breakfast on 4th floor near the pool. It is very convenient to have Your room on 4th floor. Team is extremely helpful. This hotel has the best map of Los Angeles. Business Center with excellent printers is open 24/7 . Drawback? Yes, there is one: Pool is 3' 6" deep. A mere 107cm. This is even a bit dangerous. Otherwise, it is paradise in the city.

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: passeportLondon
Reviews.Content: If you had to live in a hotel this is the one, a home from home. Classy, efficient, quiet, beautifully run. Good food, excellent staff, great rooms with no ridiculous electronics that only your 16yr old can understand. Really good location, its all good. Love the lounge bar in the evening out on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay - ever!”
Reviews.Author: Khawksc
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in Four Season, Beverly Hills, while my daughter looked at colleges in the area. We are from the southeast and did not expect southern hospitality but we got it! We had 5 Star Treatment every second ofour stay ... from the Valet parking , bellmen, front desk, room service, conciere, pool attendants, etc. (the list could go on!) We also enjoyed the hotel restuarant - great food and service! We will definately visit a Four Seasons again, especially this one! : )

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what the big deal is”
Reviews.Author: NA69Traveler
Reviews.Content: First time that I stayed here and i'm not sure i get what the big deal is. Room was nice and the service excellent. The gym was in great condition and one of the attendants gave me a glass of water while I was running on the treadmill (i've never got that level of service before)! The restaurant was okay ~ getting a table outside the bar in the evening was painful as there were often 1-2 people on tables that sat 5-6 (our group was 6). Still, the relative value of the room was much lower than the actual price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Zephion
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this hotel with my wife and son (8 years). From check in to check out this was a wonderful experience. Far too many good things to mention all but to give you an idea: Fast, welcoming valet Excellent check in Spotless room - rollaway was already in the room with child robe, slippers and amenities The hotel is not new but is very well maintained and spotlessly clean and efficiently run. This is as good as service gets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rsfwillow
Reviews.Content: Great stay with my family. Staff solicitous and helpful. Pool area very nice. Great food. Great location. Don't forget to bring long pants if you want to dine in hotel's Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “you can always be sure what you get with four seasons”
Reviews.Content: this was third four seasons hotel we were staying in and again they fulfilled highest expectations. nice breakfast, excellent conceirge , perfect pool and gym at the poolside. yes, almost forgot. very nice idea with house cars.

Reviews.Title: “How to make a memorable anniversay”
Reviews.Author: paulste2
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. This hotel and it's staff will make your stay a lasting pleasant memory. Treat your spouse the way they are intended to be treated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Awesome Food and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: stevereviews
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than 150 times and I can honestly say it's my favorite hotel overall in the world. Oh, there are fancier ones with bigger rooms, but it's the overall service and consistent quality of the food that make it great - not to mention FREE self-parking! The staff do an amazing job of knowing your name and I often witness first-time guests getting called by name right away as well. Their room service menu is teriffic and their new restaurant may look trendy, but it's excellent. Everything is low-key and the relaxed staff make it the opposite of a Ritz-Carlton property, which has always felt kind of snooty to me. No one EVER treats you that way at the Four Seasons - and everyone from the front-desk staff to the maids to the operators - are friendly and classy. If you have the money or just want to splurge, this will be an unforgetable stay. Their beds are so nice, you'll want to take one home - we did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: PhillipFS
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend for a long weekend. They gave us a nice comp upgrade at check-in...thanks! Hotel is beautiful, service is good. For a five-star, it fell short in a couple of areas... There was a large, very gross looking yellow stain on the comforter. We had to ask that they bring a new one. Not a pleasant sight. Also, a couple of guys on the bell staff were blatantly ogling my girlfriend as we were walking to the elevator...very tacky. Granted, she's very attractive but you would think the staff would have a little more class than that. All in all, great place and we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel stay of my life.”
Reviews.Author: emgarr79
Reviews.Content: Every detail, every staff member, every day was amazing! I stayed for 8 days, and felt like I never left home. It's hard to travel for business, and be away from ones own bed and comforts... but the Four Seasons LA Beverly Hills made me feel so comfortable. Everything from the room service, to pool side service was wonderful. I will be back next time I am in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: PKMMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The moment you are greeted the experience at this property is outstanding. The service levels will leave many in its wake. From the Bell, Check-In and the Concierge you will find a committed and professional staff that are welcoming and make you feel part of the hotel. The property is not new however the rooms are kept in immaculate condition and are of generous size. Whilst in the U.S.A we found dining quite challenging at times, whether it be the amount of sugar in everything (bread can taste like a cake) or the portion size which could feed a small nation we found welcome relief right here at the FS Beverley. Culina is contempory Italian Fare` that has a wonderful atmosphere and menu to match. It would be remiss of me if I didn't recommend to you the "Crumbed Veal Chop" finished off with an Affogato drowned in Frangelico The pool whilst shallow does a good job and the poolside staff attend every need. There is a small well appointed Gym and Spa adjacent to the Pool. As a Family we can not commend the staff and property management enough. Where some hotels can find Children an annoyance, this property welcomes them with open arms and fusses over them.

Reviews.Title: “Better elsewhere, little resort hotel in the middle of Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: Room 310, four seasons suite, upgraded. Three nights. Positive: location is reasonable, near Robertson, Beverly Bouv, Beverly Center (a dump). It's reasonable in that it's in a nice BH part of town you can just walk around. It's far away however from anything of interest. Staffs are absolutely top notch. Courteous. Quite helpful. Never too much. Hotel car is hard to come back, try 35 min wait. But Rolls Royce Ghost, beat that. Nice to phone and be picked up after dinner that's for sure. Room was decent. Clearly old even after renovation. Bed absolutely sumptuous. Bathroom very nice with separate bath and Niagara falls shower head. Room service good on time on both occasions, don't complain about the $$$ what do you expect??? I ended up staying two full days in the room. Was comfortable and quite enough. Negative: waited from 06:00 to 10:00 for a room. Plenty of people checked out in that time, couldn't get cleaners to focus on one tiny room to spare me the pain of lounging aimlessly for 4 hours when I already emailed them prior. One suggested I could consider booking the night prior I wonder whether they'd ever do that travelling themselves. Nuts. No one bothered to suggest how I could burn those four hours, after a 15 hour flight. It's too far from points of interest. Lastly the bathroom use in the adjoining room caused an obvious water gushing sound glad it was a suite otherwise i'd be woken up. Cheaper than Wiltshire, that's about it. Must try Montage next time. This looks the part.

Reviews.Title: “flawless”
Reviews.Author: alison245
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel was fully occupied, I felt like I was their only guest! Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: seashell1126
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay in the future. We loved the pool, spa, fitness center, room, everything about hotel. Excellent and extremely friendly staff. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beverlyshopper
Reviews.Content: Great visit. I recommend this hotel. Informed, helpful and friendly staff. Spa treatment was fabulous. Pool staff knocked themselves out To make us happy. Knockout views of the LA skyline from our standard room. Rooms very comfortable. Hotel car took us to and picked us up from lunch at the Ivy. Great service. Lounge trio was top notch, amazing people watching, just so fun.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and good”
Reviews.Author: Maneet99
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The lady at concierge Honor was very helpful. Hotel staff is active and ready to serve. The in house car and Ray were also very helpful. Room service gave me everything I asked in my room. It's a quality hotel carrying their legendary name.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- You can't go wrong at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at this hotel. We spent a month in Toronto and were SO happy to leave Toronto. During our month long stay, we only had about 6 or 7 days of good weather. The rest of the time it was raining or cloudy out. We were SO happy to get some sun! Even leaving Toronto we sat on the airport runway as there was a lightning storm and it was pouring out. We were already scheduled to arrive late but with the delay we didn't arrive until about midnight We were heading to San Diego for a week but we decided to relax after that flight and stay 2 days in LA. Glad we did. The weather was GREAT! The hotel is really beautiful and the staff is wonderful and always had smiles on their faces and were helpful. This is an extremely kid friendly hotel and the staff always went out of the way to talk to our kids. We booked 2 rooms as we have 2 small kids. The pool is really nice and we ordered room service and the food was fresh and delicious. We've stayed at several Four Seasons but not this one before but definitely I'd recommend this hotel for those coming to LA. As usual at Four Seasons, it's not cheap and you're going to spend some money but it's a great hotel chain and this location was great. Definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I have my children there and my husband”
Reviews.Author: Bailey7856
Reviews.Content: L liked everything in this hotel l loved it because I have my kids there and my husband

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Shiish
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the hotel. The staff couldn't have been more attentive and caring. They went out of their way to make our children feel special. There was nothing we needed that wasn't taken care of as soon as we asked. The pool was a wonderful place to spend the afternoons, and Cucina is a beautiful restaurant with top notch food. The spa is luxurious and the massages were as good as we've ever had. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, as every hotel should be...”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: Superb Service Excellent Location close to main attractions... Service is number one! Highly recommend it! Its not the building, its not the location, but yes the attitude of the staff that makes this Four Seasons Hotel one the finest in the World...

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best, better than all the rest!”
Reviews.Author: drw68
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Every hotel regardless of price should strive in service as this hotel does. I stayed at the Mandarin in Vegas after this and still thought of this hotel as service is top notch and every employee really makes you feel welcome. From the check in point to the departure I found this hotel one THE BEST I have ever stayed in. The rooms are beautiful and I am only disappointed that we stayed here only one night. I would return here in a heart beat. The General Manager must be so proud to have an outstanding staff that really goes the extra mile. The restaurants (by the pool) and Cucina are great. Cucina is such a wonderful experience and the ambiance is incredible. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTABULOUS HOTEL TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: ANURAGKEJRIWAL
Reviews.Content: Staff is amazing, friendly and all out to make the stay most memorable and comfortable. Hotel provides your free Rolls Royce to any place within a 2mile radius. Any bookings or tickets are booked by the staff instantly and they go that extra step to make your day enjoyable. Food in the restaurants is good and there also staff is very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Just The Best”
Reviews.Author: tojopop
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to stay at this hotel. I have been traveling for business to the Los Angeles area for over 20 years and I have pretty much stayed at all the high end (excluding the Bel Air) hotels and this is just the best. The rooms are lovely and comfortable with the legendary bedding and mattresses. We were working around the clock and we had many of our meals at the hotel-either in the bar, room service or Culina. Every meal was terrific and there is so much selection. When we were lucky enough to have some down time, the pool and spa made it feel like you really got away from it all-even for a 1/2 hour. So hats off to the staff (who are at your door in 5 minutes with whatever you need) for really caring about the guests. I can't wait to go back. Oh yeah- and the celebrity sightings are always an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - THE BEST STAY IN LOS ANGELES (SO FAR)”
Reviews.Author: skanklor1
Reviews.Content: Paid a lot for the room- got exactly what we paid for, impeccable service, great room, attention to detail. Now, I probably am a little biased since I live in a Four Seasons residence full time elsewhere, but I found the service to be great and undisappointing. Will most likely stay here every time I am in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “What other hotels should strive for”
Reviews.Author: drmike99
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property and a great location with a tremendously profesional staff. Perfect for business or relaxing vacation. Good restaurant and lounge with indoor and outdoor seating perfect for people watching. Nice pool and gym/spa as well. Expect Beverly Hills prices.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: rareflier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week, Dec. 24 - Dec. 31, 2010. We were treated with respect, every request was honored immediately, no matter what it was. With many holiday events occurring during this time, we never felt they were intrusive upon our privacy and need for quiet in the evening. Every staff member there deserves credit, but we especially remember Concierge Andrea, Front Desk agent Emma, Culina server Abigail and the Sommelier at Culina. A beautiful hotel, location just right for us.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons exceeds all expectations”
Reviews.Author: linders190
Reviews.Content: Quite simply an amazing experience. Everyone went out of their way to make our visit incredible, especially after we moved from The Montage. The interiors are beautiful and, although there were a number of events on at the hotel, you never felt this detracted from the stay for a normal guest. Rooftop pool was fantastic and the new Italian restaurant and bar amazing. Make sure to use the house car, although we missed out on the Rolls Royce! Dont stay anywhere else, especially if you are planning to shop at Rodeo and Robertson - the hotel is located perfectly midway between the two. Special thanks for Michael on front desk for making it the perfect start to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel Home in LA”
Reviews.Author: AltamonteTraveler
Reviews.Content: We travel to LA regularly to visit family. We have been long time fans of the Fairmont Miramar in Santa Monica, but have been searching for a "new home" since our son moved from that area. The Four Seasons Los Angeles at Beverly Hills was delightful. The staff is freindly, knowlegable and very professional. The character is relaxed elegance.We have tried the Montage, but it is much more formal. The food and service at the pool deck is great. The food at Culina is excellent at breakfast, lunch and dinner. Some of the items are unique, so be sure to take the waiter's recommendation. You will be pleased you did.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect: Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: After visiting many Four Seasons properties, we are starting to really appreciate the consistency across the hotels: great service, great food, great rooms, great people. This feels like a boutique hotel, and if you hang around you'll see a few celebrities. Location was great---not in the middle of all the traffic like the other Four Seasons in Beverly Hills, but close enough to Rodeo Drive to walk (abotu 10 minutes). We took the house car several times---a Rolls Royce with tinted windows---which is available on a first come first serve basis. It was fun to see what life is like for the stars as people try to see who's inside the car. My one requirement for a room: to sleep. Beds of course are not a problem at the Four Seasons, but I was concerned because the hotel isn't very high, and our room was facing the front of the hotel and a busy street. But with the A/C on constantly we heard nothing all night long and slept for 10 hours the first night. Compare this with the Ritz in Laguna Niguel---a sprawling beachfront resort---where we stayed later in the week where we heard people walking above us and everytime the A/C came on it woke us up. This seems like such a minor thing, but sleep is important whether you are on business or pleasure. Only a few complaints, which of course are minor compared to other hotels: *When we made the reservation and when we checked in we asked for a quiet room. We were given the one RIGHTNEXT to the elevators. It's a pain to go to your room only to have to then go back to the desk and then wait again for a new room. *During breakfast one morning we heard two of the waitstaff complaining to each other about their manager---guests really don't want to hear that. *One morning we had a long discussion with our server about one of the smoothies, we ordered it, but never got it. We weren't charged, and decided to forgo it, but it was strange. *There is only one pool, and it's relatively small---if there were kids there, it would not have been relaxing. One thing I would like to mention is that the staff is fabulous---no snootiness like what you'll encounter in the service people on Rodeo Drive. Everyone is treated like a valued guest no matter who you are or what you’re wearing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the whole family - both the hotel & service were flawless”
Reviews.Author: Global_Splash
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice on our recent trip to the US - once on flying in to LA and again flying out either side of a round-Californian trip. Had our two small kids with us. The hotel staff made us all (kids included) feel so well cared for, the service was always sincere, friendly, swift and you got the feeling that they would try their best to give you whatever you needed. We have particularly fond memories of the heated pool area, pool cafe and the beautiful suite we stayed in. Travelling with kids is never cheap but this hotel will make up sofa beds and put up extra rollaways without additional cost and there are good value kids menus in both the restaurant locations. Location is great, with the Getty, Universal Studios and the Hollywood sites all close by. There is a hotel car to take you on short trips but it was in high demand at night time, so plan to take taxis then. Definitely recommended - staying here was one of the highlights of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Intelligent stay”
Reviews.Author: dt2912
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel - although top of the range this hotel is so comfortable and relaxed with a good feel and atmosphere. Staff on the ball and very attentive and nothing is too much trouble. Little things that count like tea room service - with large thermos jug of boiling water. Room service meals excellently presented with attention to detail and needs. Great pool tho not huge but again cleverly thought out with peaceful atmosphere. Italian restaurant attached to hotel not exactly to standards you would expect in Europe and I felt they were trying a too hard although the prices were cheaper than standard hotel menu meals Spent 5 nights here and had a great time in Beverly Hills, great shopping , weather and people. Hotel has courtesy car and driver but we rented a car at hotel and spent some time driving around the canyons and parks. Great trip .

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PROPERTY - Love the $$$ !”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: When in Los Angeles, we always stay at Hotel Bel-Air, currently closed for extensive renovations. Although not wealthy, we are loyal Four Seasons guests, and had high expectations ; we feared we might be disappointed, especially in the perspective of swapping from an opulent old style resortlike place hidden in the canyons, to a high rise city hotel. Different it was, but we had a great time. First approach was not on the best note, as we litterally had to wait in line to reach the valet parking area. From then on, all went smoothly. Front desk attendant welcome us asking how the drive had been from the Santa Barbara property (good system). Wa had booked a Deluxe Four Seasons Suite, requesting the highest possible floor, which was only the 9th floor. Asking for a higher floor, she proposed a room upgrade, that would be on the 16th floor, for a fee. I felt it was stingy, as 7 of our last 10 nights had been at Four Seasons properties. It showed on her screen. I declined. I only take complimentary upgrades, and felt that a token of recognition might sometimes release the pressure of the $$$ hunt ... The front desk manager fgot out of his office for a personal welcome. We proceeded to the Suite, along with the Bellman. It was exquisite, albeit rather smaller than we thought it would be. Not a problem. The view was awesome, from the Design Center to Griffith Observatory to the Hollywood sign to Downtown to the ocean : we felt the 16th floor would not have purchased a better view. Exquisite decoration (special mention to the carpet pattern), plush bedding and seats, 2 large flat TV sets, ample storage, 2 french windows (seats and coffee table out there would be nice), beautiful marble bathrooms (showing its age : toilet in the bathroom, so un-Four Seasons) (special mention to the oversized shower stall with a great shower head and at last good water pressure). We only used the restaurants for breakfast each day. Perfect outdoor seating, great menu, beautiful execution, spotless service, Four Seasons price tags (possibly Beverly Hills price tags, too). We tried once the pool area for breakfast, but service was not up to standards there. Although quite compact, the pool area is very pleasant. The upper deck allows for a quieter scene, away from kids, and for some sun until 6.30 pm (in august). Pool attendants are very gracious. We did not order food there, but it looked very good and tasty. On our last day, in order to catch the last Air France flight to Paris, we wanted to have time to carefully pack our 240 lb. of luggage, and requested a late check-out, hoping for some recognition of 10 nights in Four Seasons properties across the South West. Well all we had was a blunt no, even for an hour ; until I said I was ready to pay (the all around $$$ hunt) : so it was 50% of the daily rate, for occupation until 6.00 pm. Well, we shelled those out ! This is a great Four Seasons property. It has been beautifully renovated. It is up to all and each of the brand standards. We had a lovely time, and thoroughlly enjoyed what was offered. Being loyal FS guests, we know and appreciate all this. I really find bothersome is the obvious $ hunt. Not nickel-and-diming you really, but the slightly sour note that they are your big dollars at every opportunity, never acknowledging the obscene amount of money you are spending there. I understand this is a business, not a charity, but come on. I remember discussing the company policy with the GM of One&Only Reethi Rah in the Maldives ($1.800 per night), to whom we expressed how surprised we were by all the daily attentions : the owner's directions is that they splurge on customers, it does not cost them much margin, but the customer feels cherished. Unfortunately, this is what is lacking here. Would we return ? In a heartbeat, until Hotel bel-Air resume business. We feel so welcome there, beyond our $ ; just a question of feeling, because they must be after our $ absolutely the same way !

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: bramsey
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy the bed it was so comfortable — and the desk said they do sell them! Fantastic luxury, didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, even our 2 year old...”
Reviews.Author: cgl13
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, even our 2 year old was treated like a king!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn6185
Reviews.Content: I have been to several luxery resorts/hotels, and none compare to my experience at the Four Seasons LA Beverly Hills. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the facility was beautifully decorated and maintained. I felt very pampered throughout my staff, which far exceeded my expectations. I will look for Four Seasons hotels in all of my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat location”
Reviews.Author: jalanr
Reviews.Content: We had a great night there, while driving thru town, we hit a dodgers game... The teenagers loved the local scene, I loved the attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 25 years later”
Reviews.Author: HulagirlNyny
Reviews.Content: My mother and family have been staying here since I moved to LA in 1985..we have been through earthquakes in this hotel...learned of family members passing...and visited loved ones (and ME) after surgeries at nearby Cedars .. I have given baby showers here and my mother's 50th birthday party. Now that I live in NYC it is like coming home when I return to the Four Seasons on Doheny. And while we all miss Chasens and a little known Italian place called Il Giardino the area has blossomed and we still love it..changes and all. I have stayed at Four Seasons hotels in Paris..Hawaii..all over USA...and this one oddly enough is my favorite..Paris of course is on its own page. I try to think of reasons to return to LA just to sneak a stay at this little oasis in a concrete area. My only issue is the cheesy girls who have been frequenting the bar here and at the Peninsula for decades. But what can one do? Better the ladies of the night than a wasted alcoholic Lohan hot mess...AND finally a spa. I am just happy it still gets great reviews..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic LA/Beverly Hills oasis”
Reviews.Author: CO_travel
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights as a quick weekend getaway with friends. A near-perfect stay, and exceeded expectations by far. The property has been recently renovated, so it's a great time to visit; also, its residential location on Doheny makes this an urban hotel with a resort-like feel. Booked via the Amex Platinum FH&R program. We had a Four Seasons Executive Suite (room 310), which was lovely. The room had a full marble bathroom with an extra-large shower and separate tub. The sleeping quarters were separated from the living room by fabric-covered glass French doors, and the updated carpeting, furniture and other furnishings were all very comfortable, warm and tastefully done. The step-out balcony, while not large, could fit two (standing) adults easily and overlooked the gardens below and, in the distance, the Hollywood sign was visible. Bathroom amenities were Bvlgari white tee - a change-up from the standard FS-issue L’Occitane - and came in both mini- and medium-sized containers. The only shortfall of the suite was that there were no mirrors whatsoever outside of the bathroom. At the very least, a partial mirror should be added to the sleeping quarters, and ideally a full length mirror added to the back of the closet door in the main entry as well. We ate at both the updated outdoor Cabana restaurant, located on the fourth floor pool deck, and the new Culina restaurant that's located off the lobby. Both were quite good and the service was attentive without being overbearing. Prices at both are not for the weak of wallet: You can easily spend $300 for two at each without trying very hard if alcohol is part of the mix. We hung out late the second evening at Windows Lounge, where a fairly raucous crowd of people were enjoying the live music/dancing. A terrific room, the lounge is both upscale and laid-back, and the crowd enjoying themselves just reaffirmed our feelings that the LA property has a welcoming and resort-like ambiance. That is to say, definitely high-end – but a place where stuffiness is set aside. There are limits, however: Someone did attempt to take a photograph with their camera and hotel security stepped in to forbid it; I would imagine this is in line with the hotel’s ethic of preserving an atmosphere of privacy. Spa/pool: To get to the pool deck and Cabana restaurant, one must physically pass through the small spa on the fourth floor (in fact, the restrooms that serve both the restaurant and pool are those in the locker room for the spa - a somewhat odd setup). I had pre-arranged a treatment prior to arrival and was a bit flabbergasted by the price - nearly $300 for a 90-minute treatment, before tip. However, the pre-booking advice I was given was spot on: Both treatment and the therapist were outstanding and it was quite possibly the best hotel/resort treatment I have ever had. The spa treatment area itself is lovely - whereas the locker room facility seemed like it could use an update and an expansion. Since the area services the needs of both spa attendees and pool- and restaurant-goers, it really should be at least 50% larger, if not twice the size. The showers and steam room (I did not check out the sauna) were quite nice, however, and worked well. The pool is small-ish, but terrific. The pool bottom is surfaced in a soft, gym mat-like material that’s quite comfortable. There is an elevated hot tub is at one end of the pool and was rarely used (weather was in the low 80s during our stay). Service was friendly and casual, and there are the standard ranks of folks to set up chairs and towels as well as to provide F&B service (same menu as the collocated Cabana restaurant). Thanks to the Amex late check-out we were able to extend our stay at the pool until late in the afternoon on our final day. Other: The house car is a black Rolls-Royce Phantom that we used twice - once to drop us off at dinner and again to pick us back up. The driver gave us a Four Seasons business card with the number to call when we needed him to return, and he was there within five minutes of our phoning him. Be sure to use this complimentary amenity if you can score it (is assigned on a first-come, first-served basis and cannot be reserved in advance); the driver will take you anywhere within a two mile radius of the hotel, an area that covers a lot of shopping and dining options. Bottom line: I would both return to this property without hesitation, and would highly recommend to others. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Sedate, Good Location, Private”
Reviews.Author: ExpectGreat
Reviews.Content: A good location and quiet place to stay convenient to West L.A, while avoiding the congestion of downtown Beverly Hills and of Sunset Boulevard. I have stayed regularly for several years. The service is inconsistent, slow and sometimes unduly rude or inept, not up to par for Four Seasons, though the prices are certainly high for services and room service.
